entries.title: UNICEF
entries.description: The Last Mile Supply Monitoring Project aims to better understand how for example schools, hospitals and children benefit from UNICEF’s supply programmes through integrated reporting of supply data outside of UNICEF’s current systems. I am responsible for designing and building this system.

entries.title: CBS Department of Digitalization
entries.description: Development of Use Cases for Product Authentication, Traceability and Sustainability based on Hyperledger

entries.title: NEON Software Solutions GmbH
entries.description: Developed a video course platform and a Social Media app (>100k downloads, 4.8 stars with 5000 reviews) in a team of three

entries.title: SAP SE
entries.description:
SAP SE, 3 months, Walldorf, Germany
GBO Board Office: Web Development and Bachelor Thesis "Digitization of the SAP Management Report with Storytelling"

SAP SE, 3 months, Walldorf, Germany
Practise Unit Insurance: Supporting Treasury & Risk Management (TRM/FAM) customer projects

SAP America, 3 months, Palo Alto, USA
Technical Consulting: Support customers implementation of S/4HANA in onsite projects across the US.

SAP SE, 3 months, Walldorf, Germany
Business Transformation Services Automotive & Manufacturing: Foresight Markets: Develop and evaluate use cases using cutting edge technologies like Maschine Learning, IoT, Blockchain and Virtual and Augmented Reality.

SAP SE, 3 months, Rot, Germany
Treasury & Risk Managment: Extend an ABAP report in collaboration with the Deutsche Bundesbank (German National Bank).

entries.title: SAP SE & TUM
entries.description: Preparing and supporting the Initiative Digital Transformation lecture at the Technical University Munich (TUM) held by Gerhard Oswald, Member of the SAP Supervisory Board. The seminar was awarded "Best Lecture at the Informatics Faculty" in 2019.

entries.title: Q-Summit
entries.description: Founded in 2016, the Q-Summit became the largest student organised Entrepreneurship & Innovation conference in Germany within only 2.5 years. With more than 1,000 attendees of the Q-Summit conference at the University of Mannheim, the conference represents a platform for Innovation in the Rhine-Neckar region that unites Entrepreneurs, Investors, Corporation, Researchers and Students from diverse backgrounds. I led and enabled various small teams through Design Thinking Workshops to bring Q-Summit to next level and to ensure a professional and high-quality event.
